snippet: A company hired by the city to help homeowners rebuild had a “financial disincentive” to act more quickly because it had already been paid millions of dollars upfront, an audit found.
abstract: Audit by New York City Comptroller Scott M Stringer finds that Build It Back program, which former Mayor Michael Bloomberg hoped would help homeowners rebuild after Hurricane Sandy while avoiding waste and corruption, was plagued with flaws including poor oversight of outside consultants and confusing application process.
lead_paragraph: A company hired by the city to help homeowners rebuild had a “financial disincentive” to act more quickly because it had already been paid millions of dollars upfront, an audit found.

headline.main: New York City Comptroller Cites Flaws in Hurricane Sandy Recovery Program
headline.print_headline: Audit Finds More Flaws in Program to Rebuild
